dcterms:creator: C. of Europe. Council for Cultural Co-operation. Education Committee. Modern Languages Division
dcterms:description: The Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR) is an internationally recognized standard for describing language proficiency and levels. The standard divides six levels based on language texts of different difficulty levels, from beginner to professional level.
dcterms:title: CEFR

dcterms:creator: H. Yang
dcterms:description: Chinese Learner English Corpus (CLEC) is a corpus based on learners’ English writing. There are five levels of corpus, including middle school students, college English level 4 and 6, junior and senior professional English.
dcterms:title: CLEC

dcterms:creator: Q. Xie
G. Lai
Z. Dai
E. Hovy
dcterms:description: CLOTH is a large-scale English cloze test set, which is divided into two grades: junior high school and senior high school.
dcterms:title: CLOTH

dcterms:creator: W. Xu
C. Callison-Burch
C. Napoles
dcterms:description: Newsela (NES) corpus consists of news articles. It covers articles from grade 2 to grade 12 at different levels, allowing students to practice reading on texts appropriate to their ability level.
dcterms:title: NES

dcterms:creator: S. Vajjala
I. Lučić
dcterms:description: The OneStopEnglish (OSP) corpus contains three levels of reading difficulty (primary, intermediate, and advanced), with 189 texts at each level.
dcterms:title: OSP

dcterms:creator: G. Lai
Q. Xie
H. Liu
Y. Yang
E. Hovy
dcterms:description: The Reading Comprehension Dataset From Examination (RACE) is a collection of reading comprehension materials from English exams for middle and high school students in China, divided into two levels based on grades: junior high and senior high.
dcterms:title: RACE
